title: `Segmentation fault(core dumped)` with 0.4.1 on Ubuntu 16.04
body_html:
Issue description

Got error Segmentation fault(core dumped) with version 0.4.1 on Ubuntu 16.04, even with MNIST example snippets.

PyTorch was upgraded by sudo pip3 install --upgrade torch torchvision from 0.4.0.

I inserted print(1) at the first line in main(), yet only error message was shown and 1 was not printed.

I tried working with Numpy and did not import torch, no error was raised. I swithced back to 0.4.0 and it worked well. So I guess it's related to some upgrades from 0.4.0 to 0.4.1, right;)

Code example

MNIST example

System Info

PyTorch version: 0.4.1
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.5 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.10) 5.4.0 20160609
CMake version: version 3.10.3

Python version: 3.5
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.0.176
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
Nvidia driver version: 384.130
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.0.5
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v7.a
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/cntk/libs/libcudnn.so.6

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] 18.0

body:
## Issue description

Got error `Segmentation fault(core dumped)` with version 0.4.1 on Ubuntu 16.04, even with MNIST example snippets. 

PyTorch was upgraded by `sudo pip3 install --upgrade torch torchvision` from 0.4.0.

I inserted `print(1)` at the [first line](https://github.com/pytorch/examples/blob/master/mnist/main.py#L59) in `main()`, yet only error message was shown and `1` was not printed.

I tried working with Numpy and did not import torch, no error was raised. I swithced back to 0.4.0 and it worked well. So I guess it's related to some upgrades from 0.4.0 to 0.4.1, right;)

## Code example

[MNIST example](https://github.com/pytorch/examples/blob/master/mnist/main.py)

## System Info
PyTorch version: 0.4.1
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.5 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.10) 5.4.0 20160609
CMake version: version 3.10.3

Python version: 3.5
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.0.176
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
Nvidia driver version: 384.130
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.0.5
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v7.a
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/cntk/libs/libcudnn.so.6

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] 18.0
